content: pa g e | 1 -unforgettable twisted headband- crochet pattern by tiffany polk skill level ▪ beginner-will need knowledge of basic crochet and sewing skills ▪ written in u s crochet terms gauge ▪ 15 sts x 8 row =4 in half_double_crochet materials abbreviations ▪ red heart unforgettable yarn chain s = chain s *40-100 yards in color of choice fo= fasten_off ▪ 5 mm h crochet hook half_double_crochet= half_double_crochet ▪ measuring tape space= space ▪ scissors and yarn needle repeat= repeat ▪ stitch markers st s = stitch es ▪ faux lather tag optional t-chain= turning chain copyright t m p crochet creations 2022 pa g e | 2 notes 1 headband is worked in back-and-forth row until the desired length is reached 2 chain 2 counts as a stitch 3 make sure to crochet into the turning chain to ensure edges stay straight use a stitch marker or piece of scrap yarn to mark it so it is easier to find 4 size chart and stitch counts are provided below please note that the measurements are the slightly stretched size 5 all stitch counts are approximate and based on my own gauge using the suggested yarn and hook -pattern- chain 14 for newborn-toddler sizes 3 wide chain 18 for child-adult large sizes 4 wide row 1 work half_double_crochet chain 1 half_double_crochet in 4th chain from hook *skip next chain half_double_crochet chain 1 half_double_crochet in next chain * repeat to last 2 chs skip next chain half_double_crochet in last chain row 2 chain 2 counts as half_double_crochet *skip next 2 sts half_double_crochet chain 1 half_double_crochet in next chain-space * repeat to last st skip next st work half_double_crochet into t-chain turn row 3 repeat row 2 until desired length is reached ▪ fo and leave a 12 long tail for sewing ▪ continue to assembly instructions headband row size circum count newborn 11-12 32-36 0-6 mon 12-14 36-40 6-12 mon 14-16 40-44 toddler 16-17 44-48 child 17-19 48-52 teen/sm adult 19-20 54-58 med adult 20-21 60-64 large adult 21-22 66-70 copyright t m p crochet creations 2022 pa g e | 3 -assembly- 1 fold the headband ends together forming v shapes 2 take both ends and interlock them together see image below < > 3 pinch and hold the ends together and taking the tapestry needle sew through all 4 layers all the way to the end 4 tie a knot and weave in ends then fold the headband right side out stretch and shape and wear if you have any questions or see any mistakes within this pattern please feel free to email me directly at t m pcrochetcreations@gmail com any information or photos within this pattern are
